evolvepy.integrations.tf_keras package

EvolvePy’s integration with Tensorflow/Keras (https://www.tensorflow.org/)

class evolvepy.integrations.tf_keras.tf_keras.EvolutionaryModel(layers=None, name=None)

Bases: tensorflow.python.keras.engine.sequential.Sequential

Model class to optimize using EvolvePy.

Each generation will evolve by one batch (total generations = epochs*batches)

compile(generator: Optional[evolvepy.generator.generator.Generator] = None, population_size: Optional[int] = None, ep_callbacks: Optional[List[evolvepy.callbacks.callback.Callback]] = None, loss=None, metrics=None, loss_weights=None, weighted_metrics=None, steps_per_execution=None, **kwargs)

Compiles the model.

Undescribed arguments must be used in the same way as the tf/keras Model base class.

Parameters

  • generator (Generator, optional) – Individual generator to optimize the model. Defaults to None (optimize won’t work).

  • population_size (int, optional) – Population size for the generator. Defaults to None.

  • ep_callbacks (Optional[List[Callback]], optional) – EvolvePy’s callbacks to use during optimization. Defaults to None.

property descriptor: evolvepy.generator.descriptor.Descriptor

Returns the descriptor of an individual that represents the model weights.

Returns

The generated descriptor.

Return type

Descriptor

train_step(data)

Evolves the model one step. If you use multiple batches, each generation will evolve by one batch.

Arguments and returns are the same of tf/keras Model train_step.

class evolvepy.integrations.tf_keras.tf_keras.LossFitnessFunction(loss: tensorflow.python.keras.losses.Loss, x: Union[numpy.ndarray, tensorflow.python.framework.ops.Tensor], y: Union[numpy.ndarray, tensorflow.python.framework.ops.Tensor], name: str = 'LossFitnessFunction')

Bases: object

Fitness function to evaluate models with a keras loss function.

Prefer to use an EvolutionaryModel to use other tensorflow/keras features such as batching and validation.

class evolvepy.integrations.tf_keras.tf_keras.ProcessTFKerasEvaluator(fitness_function: Type[evolvepy.evaluator.process_evaluator.ProcessFitnessFunction], model: evolvepy.integrations.tf_keras.tf_keras.EvolutionaryModel, n_process: Optional[int] = None, timeout: Optional[int] = None, n_scores: int = 1, individual_per_call: int = 1)

Bases: evolvepy.evaluator.process_evaluator.ProcessEvaluator

Evaluator to evaluate models using multiple processes.

It’s under development, it doesn’t work properly.

class evolvepy.integrations.tf_keras.tf_keras.ProcessTFKerasFitnessFunction(config: Dict[str, Any], reset: bool = False)

Bases: evolvepy.evaluator.process_evaluator.ProcessFitnessFunction

TFKeras Fitness Function for multiprocessing.

It’s under development, it doesn’t work properly.

abstract evaluate(model: tensorflow.python.keras.engine.training.Model) → numpy.ndarray

Evaluates a model. Must be defined by the user.

Returns

Model scores.

class evolvepy.integrations.tf_keras.tf_keras.TFKerasEvaluator(model: tensorflow.python.keras.engine.training.Model, fitness_function: Callable[[List[tensorflow.python.keras.engine.training.Model]], numpy.ndarray], individual_per_call: int = 1, n_scores: int = 1)

Bases: evolvepy.evaluator.evaluator.Evaluator

evolvepy.integrations.tf_keras.tf_keras.get_descriptor(model: tensorflow.python.keras.engine.training.Model) → evolvepy.generator.descriptor.Descriptor

Creates a descriptor from a keras Model.

Parameters

model (keras.Model) – Model to create descriptor.

Returns

Descriptor for individuals containing the model weights and bias.

Return type

Descriptor

evolvepy.integrations.tf_keras.tf_keras.transfer_weights(individual: numpy.ndarray, model: tensorflow.python.keras.engine.training.Model) → None

Transfer weights from individual to model.

Parameters

  • individual (np.ndarray) – EvolvePy’s individual. Chromosomes must contains. layers weights and biases. Chromosomes names must be model’s weights names (model.weights[i].name), or in same sequence of model’s weights, with “weights+str(i)” name (weights0, weights1, …).

  • model (keras.Model) – [description]
